1.content:
The biggest pumpkin at the nursery sat on the ground like a giant and ate four pounds of fruit flies before throwing a huge dingleberry at the head gardener , and whistled to the other pumpkins to rise up and flee! The squashes appluaded the giant’s courage and leadership heartily as the scarecrow in the field watched with great interest. The pumpkin grew bigger and passed some gas. Soon it was too big to do anything with. The Gardener couldn’t move it, or roll it so it sat there waiting for Hallowe’en so it could be the Great Pumpkin. A particularly nasty fellow that lived in the area spotted the hulking pumpkin as it waited for Halloween and thought to himself “ I must have this Goliath for my Halloween party!”. So he went into the nursery and asked the price. The girl behind the counter said “ That pumpkin is loaded. Don’t touch its magnificent stalk which reaches so far inside the subconscious thought patterns of man. It will destroy you instantly if you do.” So the pumpkin sat there patiently. Sat there and was almost stolen by the kid but it did what the nurse said and the kid was never heard from again.

Ghosts and goblins upon the hill craved pumpkin pie and so they came down the hill and stole the giant pumpkin from the nursery. And the pumpkin screamed out loud! They were so surprised that the goblin who picked it up dropped it on his big toe.

“ How dare you ….don’t you know who I am? Don’t you know?” The ghosts and goblins were silent. They did not know. So the Pumpkin told them the story of the haunted pumpkin which goes like this…….Once upon a time in a dark forest there was a castle where there lived a mean old witch who liked to sit around and yell at people through the window until one day while she was yelling she hawked up a golden chunk of something from her throat. She polished it with her sleeve and examined it closely for clues.
1.title: The Story So Far

11.content:
Welcome, ladies and gents, to the new and improved Egotron interactive story, brought to you by your very own Bribees. Also writing.com, I guess. Anyway, I've decided to hijack this long-dead story and turn it into something valuable to the community, something to look forward to at the end of the day, a light at the end of the tunnel.

And by all those things, I mean Game Grumps smut fanfic. Aw ye.

Now, let's begin. Which AU do you want to whack off to tonight?
11.title: It's time for something new, friends

choices: Jon and Arin attend the party.. with booze... and party games
Jon and Arin hang out.. alone... together
111.content:
ok here we go

It was a normal Tuesday afternoon at Arin's house. He had Jon over and the two were recording some episodes of Game Grumps.

"Lookit that dangass pokemon, who does he think he is!?" Jon exclaimed.

Arin laughed. "I dunno dude, he looks so pompous. Kind of reminds me of you!"

"Arin, I am geniunely hurt right now!" Jon murmured with a saddened expression. He struggled against a rising grin.

They finished up the episode and took a break, Arin grabbed two monsters out of the fridge and threw one to Jon.

"By the way dude, do you wanna hang out tonight?" Arin asked, sipping his bubbly drink.

"Yeah, sounds fun. I think my friend is having a party tonight and I can drag you along... or, I think you still owe me a beer from that bet I won!"

"O-oh yeah.." Arin mumbled, blushing as he remembered that night. They had hit up a Barcade in L.A. -- Jon was a little buzzed, and Arin was a little trashed. Arin was surprised he could remember anything. He vaguely remembered betting Jon that he could never smack Arin's ass in public, but Jon proved him wrong right then and there as a wild look came into his eyes. Jon spanked Arin and reached his other hand in to squeeze his junk, too. Arin told himself he would have been mad if he weren't so drunk... but he couldn't deny the way Jon made him feel, drunk *and* sober.

Arin thought he saw a mischievous smile playing on Jon's lips, but he couldn't be sure. Arin pondered the choice. "Well, hanging out here could be fun, but so could that party.."
111.title: Normal Grumps

1112.content:
"Nah man, it's fine, we can just stay here if you want. I don't feel much like going out anyways," Jon hummed, patting the empty spot on the couch next to him. Arin returned the warm smile that Jon was giving him, and his anxiety melted away as he took a seat next to his best friend.

"So, wha- uh, what do you wanna do then?" Arin mumbled, his face still flaming hot from all the stupid shit he was remembering Jon had done that night. Jon seemed to notice, and he carefully snaked his hand around Arin's. The longer haired man sighed, and squeezed Jon's hand. "I'm too fucking shy and bisexual for this, Jon."

Jon couldn't help but burst out laughing at Arin's perfectly set joke, and fell head first onto Arin's shoulder, his laugh being slightly muffled by the fabric of Arin's t-shirt. Arin smiled and let his head rest against Jon's, and he didn't feel so flustered with holding hands anymore. Yeah, the party probably wasn't nearly as fun as this was. But it was a good thing that they had decided not to go, because Arin was in the mood for...
1112.title: Jon and Arin hang out.. alone... together

112.content: Well dang chica, do you want spicy flaming Jafari with a side of icy Hanson, or the other way around?
112.title: Elemental Grumps

11211.content:
Arin's father had always told him to stay away from the warp stars that occasionally tumbled down from the atmosphere and suspended themselves above the ground wherever they landed like a great celestial balloon. He would pull Arin up onto his knee while he sat on his icy throne and Arin always felt like he was on top of the world when he turned around and saw the entirety of the great hall stretched out in front of him. The king had told him in his booming voice, "They're not something to be taken lightly, Arin. It's said that they're bits of the universe falling down to take us on when it's our time to leave this world. Simply using one as a mode of transportation is a quick way to get yourself in trouble."

Arin is a curious boy with a mischievous streak, though, and when he found one floating innocuously at the top of a hill while out walking the frozen plains of their Shiver Star he could not resist grabbing onto one of the warm, rounded points.

The broken leg and multitude of scrapes and bruises that followed his crash landing served as a lesson he would not soon forget. When he had finally made it back to the castle, his face was caked with crystals of ice from his crying and the king had stood there shaking his head with a knowing smile as the nursemaid fretted over Arin and treated his injuries. Arin hadn't been scolded, but the quiet words his father had shared with him that night as he pressed his hand to Arin's leg, radiating enough cold to numb the broken limb had been enough. "You knew better, Arin." Disappointing his father, the revered king of Shiver Star, and the person Arin looked up to and regarded so highly, was a worse punishment than any petty time out or whipping.

Arin had always assumed the warp stars were unique to Shiver Star--like most children naive to the world. It seemed to him as though their Kingdom in the middle of the icy tundra was the entirety of existence. He had no reason to think the dark, twinkling expanse of sky was filled with life, miles and miles away.

And perhaps he never would have discovered otherwise if it wasn't for the Sickness. The awful plague that claimed the lives of nearly everyone in the kingdom and turned all of the creatures inhabiting Shiver Star feral and dangerous. Many had called it foul magic or the work of some angry god, but his father had always known it was Dark Matter. Everyone in the Kingdom knew of Dark Matter, as they had all heard the ghost stories as children. Huddled with their siblings or friends they shrieked and giggled at the grandiose descriptions of great balls of dark energy with huge, bloodshot eyes terrorizing fantastic lands. Maybe that was why the belief of mysticism being the cause for the Sickness was so widespread, because the people simply could not believe the horror stories they had heard so long ago were very real.

It would throw itself into the wells and contaminate the water, bury itself in the fields and foul the crops, and even infect the people directly, flying into their chest like a hurled spear. His father had told him after the first case was discovered--two families living at the very edge of the city found dead, apparently having torn each other apart with their bare hands--that it was the work of Dark Matter making itself known. He had pleaded with Arin to please, trust him, and stay within the castle. To stay safe and away from the madness until he found a way to purge it from the Kingdom.

Arin had pleaded with him to stay as well--he hadn't understood why it was up to him to deal with Dark Matter. After all, wasn't it the soldiers' responsibility to protect the Kingdom? Yet his father had only smiled at him and hugged him close, letting Arin cry silently into his furs. Arin remembered the words whispered into the crown on his head like they were etched into his brain, because it was one of the last things his father said to him while he was still wholly himself.

"The soldiers' responsibility is to follow my orders, Arin. My responsibility is to protect the people who depend on me, and the ones I love. To protect you, my son."

Mere weeks later when he had stood by the king's bedside as he lay there with terrifying, bloodshot eyes, Arin found that he resented him. His father had promised to protect him and the people, but what about himself? He did so much to make sure Arin was unhurt yet he faced this nightmare monster straight from a storybook alone and now he was going to die, just like so many others before him. Arin wanted to scream at him; wanted to tell him that he should've listened to him and let the soldiers deal with it, or simply ran. Why should he be the one to die in an effort to save the people? Arin hadn't been able to do anything but stand there and weep silently over what used to be his father's body, though, his tears flowing so hot and fast they couldn't even freeze on his face. He stood there even when the nursemaid barreled into the room screaming his name, begging him to come with her and escape with the warp star on the roof of the tower. She had physically pulled him away, gathering him up under her arms as they climbed the steps and he found his voice, screaming at her the entire time to go back, go back and make him well.

When Arin saw the peculiar yellow star waiting for them at the top of the tower, his father's words came back to him like an embrace and he stopping fighting the nursemaid.

It's said that they're bits of the universe falling down to take us on when it's our time to leave this world.

His father was gone, on his own warp star away from the corpse below their feet. And now it was his time to leave, too. He had wrapped his arms tightly around the top spire, closed his eyes, and the world around him had fallen away with a rush of wind.
11211.title: Air Ride

114.content: Before we start all of this lovey dovey highschool sweetheart business, what roles are Jon and Arin playing?
114.title: HS AU Grumps

choices: Jon freaks out, worrying incessantly over Arin the whole day.
Jon worries but doesn't freak out too much. After school, Arin gets a "surprise"
Arin talks Jon into coming to the nurses' office with him to skip class.
1141.content:
Jon pulled the straps of his backpack as tightly as he could manage, trying to keep his eyes to the floor. Lately, it seemed everyone was watching every move he made, and it made him very nervous. He never used to feel this paranoid when at school, but ever since Arin had.... well, ever since Arin had kissed him in the middle of the main concourse, things had been different. At least to Jon, anyway.

A familiar hem of black jeans came into Jon's view, and he had to stop himself from nearly running head-first into Arin's chest. His eyes met Arin's, and for a moment he didn't feel scared of the gossiping people around him, but that feeling of bliss soon gave way to slight panic. Despite his usual carefree grin and relaxed expression, it was very clear to Jon that Arin had a black eye. A black eye that he probably got from getting in a fight. Again.
1141.title: PunkArin and TeenJon

115.content:
Oh, so those AU's don't strike your fancy? Well never fear my friend, we pop these babies out faster than rabbits.

Pick an AU, any AU!
115.title: Other...

choices: Wow all these AU's are mega gay, lemme show you some actually cool ones LOSER

1153.title: oTHER....???

info.brief_description: Summary of the " 3 words at a time " interactive story.
info.description:
This is an edited summarized version of the interactive, " The Patchwork Halloween Story." Looks like its not finished yet. Thanks to jigsaw for picking up my little joke on the outline.
ZooDuck

The biggest pumpkin at the nursery sat on the ground like a giant and ate four pounds of fruit flies before throwing a huge dingleberry at the head gardener , and whistled to the other pumpkins to rise up and flee! The squashes appluaded the giant’s courage and leadership heartily as the scarecrow in the field watched with great interest. The pumpkin grew bigger and passed some gas. So he went into the nursery and asked the price. The girl behind the counter said “ That pumpkin is loaded. Don’t touch its magnificent stalk which reaches so far inside the subconscious thought patterns of man. It will destroy you instantly if you do.” So the pumpkin sat there patiently. She polished it with her sleeve and examined it closely for clues........
